intro: Zornia myriadena, commonly known as the many-seed ticktrefoil, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces numerous small seeds enclosed in a pod-like fruit, which contributes to its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Zornia myriadena plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife.
